  "description": "SPIE Oil &amp; Gas Services (part of the SPIE Group) provides a complete range of services to some of the world&rsquo;s largest oil and gas companies through its network of offices in 25 countries across Africa, the Middle-East and Asia-Pacific.

Our turnover has more than doubled in the last few years thanks to the dedication of our 4,000 employees to whom we give training, recognition, and genuine opportunities for career development. In order to support this growth, SPIE Oil &amp; Gas Services is always seeking talented individuals to join its teams.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

1.)&nbsp;Package Coordinator / Turbinist&nbsp;

Reference: 2025-39755
Job Location:&nbsp;Port Harcourt, Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time
Area Activity: Mechanical, HVAC and Electrical Services
Contract Type: Permanent Contract
Contractual hours: Full time

Job Description


	SPIE Services Nigeria Limited&nbsp;is currently looking for a&nbsp;Package Coordinator/Turbinist&nbsp;to join its work force in Port Harcourt, Nigeria. The responsibility of the incumbent includes and not limited to:


Purpose


	He ensures that maintenance operations under his responsibility are carried out in strict accordance with Company&#39;s current safety rules and operating procedures and in accordance with standard industry practice, thereby guaranteeing the quality of maintenance operations, within his field, carried out on site by Contractor.


Operations:


	Organizes on site the maintenance operations which are related to turbo machines by coordinating supervisors.
	Assists the planning team by giving any technical support for the preparation of the jobs in his discipline.
	Assists specialists working under Specific Maintenance Contracts (SMC),
	Ensures that COMPANY&rsquo;s HSE regulations are respected (especially procedures related to Work Permits), as well as approved operating procedures and standard industry practice during performance of maintenance operations placed under his responsibility,
	Manages interventions using the CMMS,
	Enters intervention reports in the CMMS (including those concerning SMC) and writes the technical reports related to his field,
	Takes in charge the turbo packages in case of breakdown until correct operation status.
	Assists operation team in conducting the turbo machines.


Methods:


	Identifies recurrent corrective maintenance interventions, analyses them and suggests improvements
	Keeps a critical eye on current preventive maintenance programmes and, if need be, suggests improvements,
	Warns support teams of any recurring problems related to the availability or quality of spare parts,
	Suggests improvements and requests modifications.
	Monitors the functioning of turbo machines, by following important parameters of the packages,


Quality Assurance:


	Verifies the quality of interventions by frequent on-site checks
	He is responsible for the reliability and integrity of turbo machines


Profile
The holder of this position must have the following qualifications:


	Higher National Diploma or Certificate (HND/HNC (A-levels + 3 years. study) or BTS/DUT or equivalent.
	3 to 5 years of experience in the maintenance or operation field on gas turbine.


Specific professional knowledge:


	Gas turbine
	Gas compressor
	Ability to lead and motivate multi-national teams,
	Pride in his work, ability to maintain good relations with colleagues and others,
	Physical ability to work on offshore installations in the climatic conditions of the site.


Languages: English


	He must have proven ability as a leader of small teams. Perfectly competent and independent in his field, he must show common sense and organisational ability.


Minimum level of experience required:


	6 years or more.


Required Authorisations:


	BOSIET
	H0L0
	Able to manages interventions using the CMMS
	Oil and Gas experience
	Aero Derivative Gas Generators (Rolls Royce RB211/RT62 preferably
	Compressors (THERMODYN)
	Sync turbines
	SOLAR TAURUS 60 Dual Fuel Gas Turbine
	Understanding of plant operations, strong understanding of
	Gas Turbine and axial compressor, DCS, ESD, F&amp;G, Field Bus, Field instrumentations, PLC, Bentley Nevada and online condition monitoring system, Mechanics, Hydraulics,
	Electricity and Electronics.

&nbsp;

2.)&nbsp;Campaign Preparation Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Contract Type: Permanent Contract
Contractual hours: Full time

Job Description


	The Campaigns Preparation Supervisor is responsible for the advanced planning, coordination and preparation of heavy maintenance, construction, and integrity restoration campaigns.
	The position is responsible for delivery of low complexity (single discipline) construction and fabrication scopes, vendor-managed package restorations, integrity inspection program planning, and other campaign works.
	The position enables the effectiveness of SPIE GMC Field Execution Team (FET) resources through planning and coordination of low complexity job scopes.
	This role ensures that low complexity projects and campaigns are completed on time, within budget, and in compliance with client management systems, including Work Management System, Safe Work Practice requirements, Global Practices and specifications, and Management of Change.
	The Supervisor oversees a team of several execution leads and engineers who are responsible for developing detailed project plans and schedules.
	The team is responsible for brownfield verification of campaign requirements; conceptual construction plans and constructability assessments; development of MTOs, work packages, and resource-loaded execution schedules; oversight of onshore fabrication and pre-mobilization work, including QAQC at vendor sites; management of third party vendors; and ensuring adherence to client specifications and relevant codes and standards.


Profile


	Technical Diploma or equivalent experience
	10+ years of experience in construction or campaign planning and execution
	Strong leadership and team management skills
	Excellent problem-solving abilities
	In depth knowledge of construction processes, safety regulations, and quality standards
	Expertise in project management, piping, welding, fabrication, and offshore topsides structural elements
	Proficiency in maintenance planning software
	Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively interact with team members, vendors, and senior management.
	Supervisory role within oil and gas industry
	Relevant certification such as Project Management Professional (PMP).

&nbsp;

3.)&nbsp;Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC) Specialist (Triconex)

Job Location:&nbsp;Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time
Contract Type: Fixed Term Contract
Contract Duration: Based on AKPO contract duration

Job Description


	SPIE Services Nigeria Limited&nbsp;is currently looking for a&nbsp;PLC Specialist (Triconex) to join its workforce in Nigeria.


Responsibilities


	Direct responsibility for the maintenance, operation and configuration of the hardware and software of the Akpo Safety Instrumented System (Schneider Electric Triconex System) subsystem of the Integrated Control and Safety System (ICSS).
	Partial responsibility for the Programmable Logic Controllers (PLC), Human Machine Interfaces (HMI) and associated devices of all Packages within the AKPO Industrial Information System (SII).
	Maintain, operate and perform routine tasks on the Process Safety System (PSS), Fire and Gas System (FGS) and Emergency Shutdown System (ESD) of the Triconex Safety Instrumented System.
	Apply and manage maintenance inhibitions in the systems as requested, directed and controlled by COMPANY rules and procedures. Register and maintain all such inhibitions on the AKPO Inhibition Tool database as par COMPANY rules.
	Prepare with the ICSS Adminstrator preventive and corrective actions and modifications of the Control Systems under his responsibility.
	Manage and document in technical reports, interventions using the CMIMS and work packs provided by the planning team.
	Follow up the parameter values and alarms in the concerned systems under his responsibility and perform trouble shooting if required.
	Maintain an accurate and auditable log of all system faults and inhibits (Short term and long term).
	Identify, in the preparatory stage of maintenance works, any sensitive operation and ensure that a proper assessment of the risks involved is carried out beforehand.
	Review and assure that all Software Modifications and corrective actions are&nbsp; validated by COMPANY and all impacted documentations are updated after implementation.


Profile


	Knowledge of the oil and gas treatment process, installations and equipment.
	Advanced knowledge and skill in Schneider&#39;s Triconex Safety Instrumented Systems.
	Knowledge of general instrumentation concepts, field devices (sensors and final elements), instrument loops, etc.
	Awareness &nbsp;of &nbsp;Emerson&#39;s &nbsp;DeltaV &nbsp;Process &nbsp;Control &nbsp;System, &nbsp;Siemens&#39; SIMATIC &nbsp;Industrial &nbsp;Automation &nbsp;Systems &nbsp;and &nbsp;Allen Bradley&#39;s ControlLogix System is an added advantage.


Required Authorisations
The holder of this position must have the following qualifications:


	Minimum level of experience required:&nbsp;6 years or more
	6 years of experience in the field of Control and Safety Systems and a minimum of 3 years as a Specialist in Control and Safety systems in the Oil and Gas / Petrochemical industry.
	Awareness of SAP CMIMS or similar.
	Awareness of Operator Training Simulators.
	Safety Instrumented Systems certificate.

  "description": "International Breweries Plc - Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. Beer, the original social network, has been bringing people together for thousands of years.
